messages.title: A letter from Alex Sobel, Labour's candidate to be our MP
messages.content:
Dear Resident,
This time last year, I was leading the Labour Remain campaign in North Leeds. I passionately believed that Britain should stay within the European Union, and I worked tirelessly knocking on doors across Leeds to make the case for our place in Europe.

During the campaign senior Conservatives promised that Brexit wouldn’t be the hard Brexit we are being offered now. Michael Gove, for example, said 'Britain would retain access to the single market'.

During the Parliamentary debate to trigger Article 50, Labour tabled nine vital amendments to protect our relationship with Europe. Labour amendments included:
- allowing EU Citizens already here to stay in the UK
- protecting workers' rights
- securing full access to the Single Market

These safeguards were all voted down by the Conservatives.

Nearly every MP voted on the final reading of the Bill to trigger Article 50, as this was perhaps the most important vote a generation.

As a fellow resident of Leeds North West, you may – like me – have been disappointed to learn that Greg Mulholland MP did not vote on that final reading.

Leeds North West decisively voted Remain in the referendum. Had I been your MP, I would have voted to reflect the wishes of my constituents.

A Labour government will replace the current Brexit White Paper with a new set of negotiating priorities, putting safeguards and protections for working people first.

A Labour government will also make sure that Parliament has the final say on the Brexit deal – and as your MP, I promise you that I will ensure that the voice of Leeds North West is heard.

I also believe that the British people deserve to have their views heard on the final Brexit deal negotiated by the British government. We need a meaningful vote before any deal is accepted.

Best wishes,

Alex Sobel

P.S.
In the last General Election 2 years ago, just 6% separated Labour and the Liberal Democrats with the Tories a distant third. Tactical voting isn’t a factor here in Leeds North West. You can vote for your values and a true Pro-European voice.

I passionately believed that Britain should stay within the European Union.
